segments.en: My name is Marco, and I'm joined here by the lovely Erica.
segments.cn: 我叫马尔科，身边有可爱的艾瑞卡。

segments.en: And today we're going to be bringing you another great lesson, one of the lessons that you requested.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来另一个精彩的课程，这是您们请求的课程之一。

segments.en: Actually, Maxim, Maxim S, requested this one.
segments.cn: 实际上，是马克西姆，马克西姆·S，请求了这个。

segments.en: Right, I think he's really into research and investigation, so we're bringing you a great lesson about this topic.
segments.cn: 对，我觉得他真的很喜欢研究和调查，所以我们带来了一个关于这个主题的精彩课程。

segments.en: Okay, so I'm really excited to hear this dialogue all about research.
segments.cn: 好的，我真的很期待听到这段关于研究的对话。

segments.en: So why don't we start listening to two university professors discussing an important question.
segments.cn: 那我们为什么不开始听两位大学教授讨论一个重要问题呢？

segments.en: We've been over this a thousand times.
segments.cn: 我们已经讨论过一千次了。

segments.en: Look, we've done extensive research, built studies and read the literature, and there is conclusive evidence to support my theory.
segments.cn: 看，我们进行了广泛的研究，建立了研究和阅读文献，有确凿的证据支持我的理论。

segments.en: Even in your most recent study, the investigative approach was flawed.
segments.cn: 即使在你最近的研究中，调查方法也是有缺陷的。

segments.en: You know as well as I do.
The collection of data was not systematic, and there's a large margin of error.
segments.cn: 数据收集并不系统，误差很大。

segments.en: To draw a definitive conclusion based on that data would be misleading.
segments.cn: 基于这些数据得出明确结论是误导性的。

segments.en: You are trying to single-handedly solve one of the world's greatest mysteries, and yet you're oblivious to the fact that you're wrong.
segments.cn: 你试图单枪匹马解决世界上最大的谜团，却对自己是错的毫无察觉。

segments.en: Which came first, the chicken or the egg?
It's an age-old question, isn't it?
segments.cn: 这是一个古老的问题，不是吗？

segments.en: And apparently they are not going to agree anytime soon.
segments.cn: 显然，他们不会很快达成一致。

segments.en: All right, well, what they can agree about is this awesome language.
segments.cn: 好吧，他们可以达成一致的是这个很棒的语言。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at it now in Language Takeaway?
segments.cn: 那我们现在来看看语言要点吧？

segments.en: Language Takeaway Okay, on Language Takeaway today we have some really great words, and this first one is really good.
segments.cn: 语言要点 好的，今天的语言要点我们有一些很棒的单词，第一个非常好。

segments.en: Okay, so if the professor says that the data is irrefutable, what does he mean by that?
segments.cn: 好的，如果教授说数据是不可否认的，他是什么意思？

segments.en: He's saying that you cannot deny it.
There is no way this is a lie.

segments.cn: 好的，例如，不可否认的证据。
是的，这是一个很好的短语。

segments.en: All right, so the professor complained that Dr. Harlowitz's experiment was flawed.
segments.cn: 好的，教授抱怨哈洛维茨博士的实验有缺陷。

segments.en: Is that an adjective, a verb, or a noun?
segments.cn: 这是形容词、动词还是名词？

segments.en: Now, when something is flawed, there is a problem with it, right?
segments.cn: 当某事有缺陷时，它有问题，对吗？

segments.en: Okay, so it has an error.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它有一个错误。

segments.en: Okay, so this adjective is a way of saying that his experiment has a flaw.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这个形容词是说他的实验有缺陷。

segments.en: So, flawed is the adjective of a flaw.
segments.cn: 所以，有缺陷的是缺陷的形容词。

segments.en: Now, the reason that his study or his experiment was flawed is because it was not systematic.
segments.cn: 现在，他的研究或实验有缺陷的原因是因为它不系统。

segments.en: So, systematic, that's an interesting word.
segments.cn: 所以，系统的，这是一个有趣的词。

segments.en: Now, I think we can recognize the word system in here, right?
segments.cn: 现在，我想我们可以在这里识别出“系统”这个词，对吗？

segments.en: So, when something is systematic, it follows a process.
segments.cn: 所以，当某事是系统的，它遵循一个过程。

segments.en: Right, so that's basically what systematic means, to follow a certain order, to be more organized, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以这基本上就是系统的意思，遵循一定的顺序，更有组织，对吗？

segments.en: Okay, and what about our next word?

segments.cn: 通常是一起使用的，对吗？

segments.en: Okay, so what does it mean when I say that?
segments.cn: 好的，当我说这个时，它是什么意思？

segments.en: It means it's absurd, it's ridiculous.
segments.cn: 这意味着它是荒谬的，荒唐的。

segments.en: I can't believe you said that.
segments.cn: 我无法相信你说了那样的话。

segments.en: Alright, well this is a really interesting phrase, but I think it's a little bit more common when it's used by older people.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个非常有趣的短语，但我觉得它在老年人中更常用。

segments.en: Yeah, I don't really see a young person going up to someone and say, hey, that's preposterous.
segments.cn: 是的，我不太看到年轻人走到某人面前说，嘿，那太荒谬了。

segments.en: Yeah, but it is a wonderful phrase.
segments.cn: 是的，但这是一个很棒的短语。

segments.en: Now, our final phrase for takeaway, oblivious.
segments.cn: 现在，我们最后一个要点是，无知的。

segments.en: So, a person that is oblivious to something.
segments.cn: 所以，一个对某事无知的人。

segments.en: They don't know, or they're unaware.
segments.cn: 他们不知道，或者他们没有意识。

segments.en: Okay, so they ignore maybe the facts, or they don't see it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他们可能忽视事实，或者他们没有看到。

segments.en: Yep, you're oblivious to the fact that we're in a recession.
segments.cn: 是的，你对我们处于衰退的事实无知。

segments.en: Okay, or he is completely oblivious.
You can just say it like that, right?
Okay, so we took a look at some of the great vocabulary we found in the dialogue, but there were also some really good phrases that I think we should look at.
segments.cn: 好的，我们看了一些在对话中找到的很棒的词汇，但还有一些我认为我们应该看看很好的短语。

segments.en: Okay, and let's take a look at those and putting it together.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看这些并把它们结合起来。

segments.en: You know, Marco, one of the things I love about English is the way that words seem to fit together, like blocks coming together.
segments.cn: 你知道，马尔科，我喜欢英语的一件事是单词似乎像积木一样组合在一起。

segments.en: And here we have a lot of great examples of these words that fit together really nicely.
segments.cn: 在这里我们有很多这些单词的很好的例子，它们组合得非常好。

segments.en: Okay, so why don't we look at those?
segments.cn: 好的，那我们为什么不看看这些呢？

segments.en: And our first one now is extensive research.
segments.cn: 我们的第一个短语是广泛研究。

segments.en: All right, so we know extensive means?
segments.cn: 好的，我们知道广泛的意思是？

segments.en: So that's really good when you put it together.
segments.cn: 所以当你把它结合起来时，这真的很好。

segments.en: You have really studied, you have really looked things up.
segments.cn: 你真的研究过，你真的查过资料。

segments.en: Another great research-related phrase here is conclusive evidence.
segments.cn: 另一个与研究相关的优秀短语是确凿证据。

segments.en: All right, now the first word there, conclusive.
segments.cn: 好的，那里第一个词，确凿。

segments.en: When something is conclusive, you can't argue with it.
segments.cn: 当某事是确凿的时，你无法争辩。

segments.en: All right, well, the professor complained that Horowitz's investigative approach was flawed, right?
segments.cn: 好的，教授抱怨说Horowitz的调查方法有缺陷，对吧？

segments.en: So this is our next phrase, investigative approach.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们的下一个短语，调查方法。

segments.en: Okay, so I remember the word investigate is a verb.
segments.cn: 好的，我记得调查这个词是动词。

segments.en: But in this case, it's a... It's an adjective.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，它是...它是形容词。

segments.en: When something is investigative, it's obviously having to do with... An investigation.
segments.cn: 当某事是调查性的时，显然与...调查有关。

segments.en: So when he said investigative approach...
segments.cn: 所以当他说调查方法时...

segments.en: Just the... I mean, just simply the way you investigate the problem.
segments.cn: 只是...我的意思是，仅仅是你调查问题的方式。

segments.en: What about this other phrase that I saw?
segments.cn: 那我看到的另一个短语呢？

segments.en: All right, well, again, I think we know the word conclusion, right?
segments.cn: 好的，我想我们知道结论这个词，对吧？

segments.en: So it's a final judgment or decision.
segments.cn: 所以这是最终的判断或决定。

segments.en: When something is definitive, you can't argue with it or change it.
segments.cn: 当某事是确定性的时，你无法争辩或改变它。

segments.en: Okay, so the conclusion or the final result is final.
segments.cn: 好的，所以结论或最终结果是最终的。

segments.en: Like there is no way of arguing it.
So why don't we listen to it one more time in the dialogue?
segments.cn: 那我们为什么不再听一遍对话呢？

segments.en: We've been over this a thousand times.
segments.cn: 我们已经讨论过一千次了。

segments.en: Look, we've done extensive research, built studies and read the literature, and there is conclusive evidence to support my theory.
segments.cn: 看，我们进行了广泛的研究，建立了研究并阅读了文献，有确凿的证据支持我的理论。

segments.en: Even in your most recent study, the investigative approach was flawed.
segments.cn: 即使在你最近的研究中，调查方法也是有缺陷的。

segments.en: You know as well as I do, the collection of data was not systematic, and there's a large margin of error.
segments.cn: 你和我一样知道，数据收集并不系统，并且有很大的误差范围。

segments.en: To draw a definitive conclusion based on that data would be misleading.
segments.cn: 基于这些数据得出确定性结论将是误导性的。

segments.en: You are trying to single-handedly solve one of the world's greatest mysteries, and yet you're oblivious to the fact that you're wrong.
segments.cn: 你试图单枪匹马解决世界上最大的谜团之一，但你却无视自己是错的事实。

segments.en: So an interesting question, what do you think?
segments.cn: 所以一个有趣的问题，你觉得呢？

segments.en: What came first, the chicken or the egg?
Well, if you ask me, it was the egg.
What about why did the chicken cross the road?
To get to the other side.
Do you think that's really the reason?
segments.cn: 你认为这真的是原因吗？

segments.en: Well, there's a million different reasons, but this is great.
segments.cn: 嗯，有一百万种不同的理由，但这很好。

segments.en: I'm glad you brought that up because this is like the classic English joke.
segments.cn: 我很高兴你提到这个，因为这是经典的英语笑话。

segments.en: Why did the chicken cross the road?
Well, there are a million answers.
So do you guys know any chicken jokes?
segments.cn: 所以你们知道任何鸡的笑话吗？

segments.en: Yeah, why don't you come to our website, EnglishPod.com, and on the comments section, why don't you leave us your thoughts on what came first, the chicken or the egg?
segments.cn: 是的，为什么不来我们的网站EnglishPod.com，在评论区留下你对鸡和蛋哪个先来的想法呢？

segments.en: And why do you think the chicken crossed the road?
segments.cn: 还有你认为鸡为什么过马路？

segments.en: Well, we really look forward to hearing your ideas.
segments.cn: 我们真的期待听到你的想法。

segments.en: And Marco and I will be around to answer your questions.
segments.cn: Marco和我会在这里回答你的问题。

segments.en: So I think we're out of time for today, but thanks for listening and... We'll see you there.
segments.cn: 所以我想我们今天的时间到了，但谢谢你的收听...我们下次见。
